Items.Title: Resolution supporting proposed bipartisan federal legislation for comprehensive immigration reform and urging Congress and President Bush to adopt such legislation.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Avella.

The following 3 Council Members formally voted to abstain: Council Member Gallagher, Lanza and Oddo.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Supporting proposed bipartisan federal legislation for comprehensive immigration reform.

Items.Title: Resolution expressing continued opposition to the  REAL ID Act of 2005, included as part of the Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Act passed by Congress and signed by President Bush in May 2005 and urging New York State to opt out of implementing the law’s provisions regarding issuance of driver’s licenses to immigrants.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Avella, Gallagher and Oddo

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Expressing grave concern regarding the passage of the REAL ID Act of 2005.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Office of Immigration and Customs Enforcement to exercise prosecutorial discretion and decline to pursue orders of removal or to carry out removal orders in exceptional situations where deportation would cause extreme hardship to individuals themselves, family or community members and further urging restoration of discretion to immigration judges to defer deportation in exceptional cases.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 4 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Avella, Gallagher, Lanza and Oddo.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Approved, by Council
Items.MatterName: US Office of Immigration Customs Enforcement to exercise prosecutorial discretion.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt legislation that provides for the civil commitment of sexually violent predators to protect the public from those whose mental abnormalities makes them likely to commit sexually violent crimes.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Provides for civil commitment of sexually violent predators to protect the public from those whose mental abnormalities makes them likely to commit sexually violent crimes.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting legislation increasing the number of sex offenders required to register for life.

Items.MinutesNote:

The following Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item: Council Members Fidler.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Requiring all sex offenders to register for life.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to increase penalties for those who commit sex offenses against children, similar to provisions adopted in Florida as part of the Jessica Lunsford Act.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Approved, by Council
Items.MatterName: Enact sex offense provisions similar to those adopted in Florida, as part of the Jessica Lunsford Act.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of legislation that improves the national program to register and monitor individuals who commit sex offenses against children.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Support of U.S. Senate bill S.1086, which improves the national program to register and monitor individuals who commit sex offenses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the removal of graffiti from commercial and residential buildings, and in relation to establishing a process whereby the city may clean graffiti from these buildings.
Items.MatterName: Imposing a fine against the owners of commercial buildings and residential buildings of six or more units who do not remove graffiti from their premises.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to expeditiously enact the Clean Water Protection/Flood Prevention Act that would strengthen protection of wetlands in New York State and safeguard and enhance New York City’s water supply quality, pollution treatment, flood control, open space and natural areas.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Enact the Clean Water Protection/Flood Prevention Act.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate federal and state agencies, and the public, to provide all natural gas supply projects, including the proposed Broadwater Energy Project, a fair and full review, in light of the important role that natural gas is projected to play in enhancing the reliability of energy resources, increasing diversity of supply sources, reducing energy price volatility, and protecting environmental and public health in New York City.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Appropriate federal and state agencies, and the public, to provide all natural gas supply projects.

Items.Title: Resolution rejecting the proposals of the President’s Advisory Panel on Federal Tax Reform to eliminate the deductibility of state and local taxes and replace the deduction for mortgage interest and calling upon the President and Congress to reject these proposals as well and to index the alternative minimum tax (AMT) for inflation.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committees on Finance and State and Federal Legislation
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Approved, by Council
Items.MatterName: Proposals of the President’s Advisory Panel on Federal Tax Reform to eliminate the deductibility of state and local taxes.
